CopyPricesFromOtherPriceListData.description:
The data that accompanies a Component with Type = PricesFromOtherPriceList which is a component to copy prices from another pricelist.

Is useful for example for promotion prices, where you first 'import' the prices from the original pricelist, and then apply a negative markup to them to create a promotion discount.

Which prices you copy can be modified by specifying a ProductSearchTemplateID, only products that are contained in the results of the search will be copied,
unless ExcludeProductsInFilter is set to true, in which case the reverse is true; all products except the matching ones will have their prices copied.

Delete.description: If specified as true, the component will be deleted.

EndDate.description: Determines when this component will become inactive. After this date the component will not be included in the calculation of the pricelist.

ID.description: The unique identifier for this component. Required.

MarkupData.description:
The data that accompanies a Component with Type = Markup which is a component that alters the price value of the previusly applied components,
either up or down. The markup/markdown can either be an absolute value or a percentage depending on the Type.

Name.description: The name of the component. If left empty on creation of the component the ID will be used as the name.

OverrideCurrentCalculatedPrice.description:
Determines if the price resulting from this component simply replaces the value as calculated by preceding components or if it's a relative value.

It defaults to false.

This affects the different component types in the following ways:

PriceEntries:

If OverrideCurrentCalculatedPrice = true then the value of the price entry replaces any value by a previous component. If false (the default) then the price entry is added to the existing value.

So if a previous component calculated that the price should be 100 and there is a price entry for 90, then with OverrideCurrentCalculatedPrice = true the resulting price will become 90. With false, it would become 190.

Markup:

It's only applied to a markup component if it has Type = Amount, it does not have any effect for Type = Percentage.

If set to true, a Amount markup component will function like a price entry compnent and replace the current value with the amount of the markup component.

If false (the default) it will add the Amount of the markup component to the current calculated value.

PriceEntriesData.description:
The data that accompanies a Component with Type = PriceEntries, so a component that is simply a list of product/price pairs.
The simplest and most direct way to give a product a price.

This data consists of either a list of product/price pairs or a BlobID which is a reference to a previously created blob in EVA that contains data of the following format:

[
    {
      "ProductID": "<ProductID>",
      "Price": <Price>
    },
    ...
]

If you only supply a handful of prices, the inline data works well, but for large quantities of prices you may want to use the BlobID method.

This data is ignored for all other Component types.

PriceEntries data is processed asynchronously in the background and will not be immediately visible after the service call returns.

PricingGroupID.description: The PricingGroupID that this component is active for. Components with a PricingGroupID are only active for users that are members of that group. If left empty the component will be active for all users.

SequenceNumber.description: Components are applied in the order of their sequence number, from lowest to highest.

StartDate.description: Determines when this component will become active. Until then the component will not be included in the calculation of the pricelist.

Type.description: Determines the type of the component. Cannot be changed after creation.
